vulnerability_findings.name: non-payable-constructor
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: constructor() public {}
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider making costructor payable to save gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == admin, "only admin may initialize the market");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-multiple-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(accrualBlockNumber == 0 && borrowIndex == 0, "market may only be initialized once");
vulnerability_findings.message: Using multiple require statements is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == admin, "only admin may initialize the market");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: compound-borrowfresh-reentrancy
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: doTransferOut(borrower, borrowAmount);
vulnerability_findings.message: Function borrowFresh() in Compound performs state update after doTransferOut()

vulnerability_findings.name: erc20-interface
vulnerability_findings.message:
EIP20NonStandardInterface (CSLPDelegate.sol#1271-1333) has incorrect ERC20 function interface(s):
	-transfer (CSLPDelegate.sol#1297)
	-transferFrom (CSLPDelegate.sol#1311)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in CToken._addReservesInternal (CSLPDelegate.sol#2182-2194):
	External calls:
	- error = accrueInterest() (CSLPDelegate.sol#2183-2184)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- totalReserves (CSLPDelegate.sol#2190-2191)

	- cashOnChainAfter = getCashOnChain() (CSLPDelegate.sol#2570-2571)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- internalCash (CSLPDelegate.sol#2576-2578)

	State variables written after the call(s):

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: pragma solidity ^0.5.16;
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in CSLPDelegate.sol:
	- Version used: ['ABIEncoderV2', '^0.5.16']
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#3 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#77 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#110 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#494 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#680 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#768 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16

	- CSLPDelegate.sol#1264 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#1337 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#2418-2421 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#2931-2934 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#2978-2979 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- CSLPDelegate.sol#2979-2982 declares pragma experimentalABIEncoderV2
